column4: Hello I'm trying automate a Ubuntu install using pxe and a preseed file, Ubuntu boots and the installer kicks off but fails to detect disk, I get "No root file system is defined". If switch to the shell terminal, and issue fdisk, I don't see any disk. If manually install Ubuntu using the CD-ROM on the same server, the installation detects the disk. Is there something I need to pass as a kernel parameter to get this working. My server is a HP 360. Thanks
does the disk have hardware raid setup ?
yes I am using hardware raid
this is common when pxe booting, I've got a note on this, hang on
did you respond, my IRC client crashed?
just trying to find my notes on this
I've gone through this pain with redhat and kickstart, the process should be the same with ubuntu
not sure what process you are referring, I'm not experiencing this issue with my RHEL servers on the same hardware
ooh really, it's working on your RHEL setup
works fine with RHEL, no special configuration, other that I'm kickstarting
rhel 5 (I assume you're using 5) must have it sorted then as 3 certainly didn't and I don't think 4 did
I can't find the darn module line, but basically you need to pass the cciss module at boot time

how would pass the cciss module as kernel boot parameter. Another thing, I did modprobe -l on the problem server from the installation terminal, i did not see any cciss.ko file. shouldn't't i be seeing the module from that output
it's not called cciss.ko - I can't remember the name and I don't have access to a dl to check it
really, let me look around, in the mean time, how would I load the module from the pxe installer
